events.message: The customer reported a car accident that happened on the morning of May 9th involving their vehicle colliding with another car at an intersection.
The claim has been categorised under Auto Accident based on the provided description mentioning vehicle collision and damages to the car.
An insurance agent has been assigned to handle this particular automobile accident claim and will start documentation collection.
The claim has been officially acknowledged by the insurance company and the customer has received confirmation via email.
Requested the customer to submit police report, vehicle repair estimate, and photos of damage to proceed with the investigation.
Customer has submitted all requested documents including police report and mechanic’s detailed repair estimate for their damaged vehicle.
An internal investigation has begun to verify the circumstances of the car accident and assess claim validity.
The investigation team has concluded that the customer is not at fault in the accident, and damage reports are consistent.
A settlement offer covering vehicle repair costs has been proposed to the customer for their review and approval.
The customer responded positively to the settlement offer, appreciating the prompt and fair handling of the claim.
Following customer acceptance, the claim has been officially approved for payment and further processing.
Payment covering the agreed vehicle repair amount has been issued to the customer’s designated account.
The auto accident claim has been successfully closed after the payment was processed and customer confirmed repairs.
The case files and documentation related to the vehicle collision claim have been archived for record-keeping.
